content.raw:
It does allow you to make tabs very small though, meaning you can put devices which only have DDs outputs (e.g. Novatechs) in a small tab area, and then have a much bigger area for devices with lots of buttons, like an NI board with many digital outputs.

I did notice that the "f" appears to be cut off a bit due to the italics, and looks like a "t"

![f.PNG](data/bitbucket.org/repo/xg9BdE/images/342367673-f.PNG)

We should abbreviate the labels on the "remote values changed" popup too, and maybe put its contents in its own scroll area, with the apply button right-aligned below it (outside of the scrollable area), rather than sharing the same scroll area as the tab's output widgets.
